Events that occurred on 23 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1923 - Bulletin of the Modern Humanities Research Association 20, containing an obituary written by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
1937 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 18.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 86.
1958 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 212a.
1999 - Hiswelókë's Sindarin dictionary begins.
2008 - The Spoken Word: British Writers, featuring an interview with J.R.R. Tolkien, is released.
2014 - Writer and actor Bernard Mayes dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo recovers from his wound in Rivendell. Elrond finds the blade shard in his shoulder and removes it.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
